CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 13, 1969, pg. 1, reads: "$500 Savings Account, Baby David Southers, winner of The New Courier's annual baby contest, takes a good grip on the $500 Pittsburgh National Bank savings account he won. Master Southers, son of Mr. and Mrs. Carl Southers, of 756 Cherokee St., accepts the account from New Courier Contest Editor Kenneth W. Morris as Mrs. Southers smiles her approval.  Baby Southers tallied 366,040 votes to win the newspaper's second annual contest.  Other pictures of the lucky winners and their prizes will be published next week.  Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Kenneth W. Morris presenting savings account to Dolores Southers, holding son David Southers, standing behind prize table with Westinghouse Solid State Stereophonic record player and other appliances from New Pittsburgh Courier baby contest, in Southers home, 756 Cherokee Street
